unnormalised: The costs associated with gastroenterological treatments can be a significant burden for many families. Government initiatives like Ayushman Bharat are helping to make healthcare more accessible and affordable. Patients can avail treatment at empanelled hospitals for conditions like hepatitis and cirrhosis, with coverage up to Rs. 5 lakh.

unnormalised: Technological advancements are also playing a crucial role in the field of gastroenterology. Minimally invasive procedures like endoscopic ultrasound (EUS) are becoming increasingly common, allowing doctors to diagnose and treat conditions with greater precision. "They are less painful, have shorter recovery times, and lead to better outcomes for patients."
